bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Manuel Perez Beato, June 21, 1923

div1.p: Carter writes Beato for information about malignant fevers occurring in Cuba in 1620.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Manuel Perez Beato, June 21, 1923
div1.opener:
------- F. F. Russell,
Book
Cuba
2121 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.,
June 21, 1923.
/LC
Dr. Manuel Perez Beato,
Escuela Profesional de Artes y Oficio,
Belascoain Calle,
Habana,
Cuba.
Dear Doctor Beato:
div1.p:
Dr. Jorge Le-Roy y Cassa has kindly given me your address as
that of one who could possibly give me some information on the ma-
lignant fevers, which occurred in Cuba in 1620, or, if not, could
advise me where I could get such data. Paezuela simply mentions
their occurrence.

Cuba, indeed, seemed to have been far more healthful than the
other islands or the coasts of any part of the mainland until the
the great epidemic of 1761, which quite certainly came from Vera
Cruz.
div1.closer:
With highest regards, I remain
Very truly yours. Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
2121 California Street, N. W.,
Washington, D.C.
